metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1898 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: FFmpeg 2.x allows remote attackers to conduct cross-origin attacks and readarbitrary files by using the subfile protocol in an HTTP Live Streaming(HLS) M3U8 file, leading to an external HTTP request in which the URLstring contains an arbitrary line of a local file.

criterions.comment: libav: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
